benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Remove tags from account

covered: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: single, multiple, and all-tags deletion with 204 and empty body (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC13, TC19, TC20).
DELETE Method - Non-Existent/Invalid Resource: 400 for non-existent account and invalid UUID format (TC06, TC07).
Input validation of query params: malformed/invalid tagDef, mixed valid/invalid, missing/empty tagDef handled (TC03, TC08, TC14, TC18, TC20).
Required/optional headers: missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy -> 400; optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC04, TC09, TC19).
Business rule: AUTO_PAY_OFF removal blocked when no default payment method -> 400 (TC10).
Unexpected query params tolerated without error (TC11).
Service resilience: 5xx when service down; retry after transient network recovers to 204 (TC12, TC16).
Concurrency/performance: concurrent DELETEs complete within acceptable time and succeed (TC17).
Idempotency behavior implicitly covered by deleting when no tags present returning 204 (TC05).
gaps: DELETE Method - Concurrency on the same resource: race conditions when two clients delete the same tags on the same account concurrently (idempotent final state, no 409/500) are not tested.
Soft delete vs hard delete: not verified whether tag removal is soft (audited/tombstoned) or hard delete; audit/history behavior not asserted.
Story contract: Produces application/json — error responses are not validated for Content-Type and error schema consistency.
AUTO_PAY_OFF positive path: removal should succeed (204) when a default payment method exists; no explicit test.
Partial presence: when some provided tagDef values are not applied to the account, expected behavior (204 vs error) is not covered.
Duplicate tagDef values: behavior with repeated tagDef parameters (de-duplication/no error) is not covered.
CollectionFormat=multi specifics: acceptance of repeated tagDef parameters vs rejection of comma-separated lists is not validated.
Audit propagation: CreatedBy/Reason/Comment persistence to audit logs/history is not asserted.
Response headers for 204: headers such as Content-Type (absence for 204) and other standard headers are not verified.
recommendations: Add a scenario with two concurrent DELETEs targeting the same account and same tag(s) to prove idempotent final state and absence of race errors.
Verify audit trail persistence for X-Killbill-CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment in deletion history/audit logs.
Validate error response contract: ensure 400/5xx responses return Content-Type: application/json and conform to an agreed error schema.
Add a positive test for removing AUTO_PAY_OFF when a default payment method exists (expect 204).
Add a scenario where multiple tagDef values are provided but some are not applied; expect 204 and removal of only present tags, asserting final state.
Add a scenario with duplicate tagDef query params to confirm de-duplication and successful 204.
Explicitly test collectionFormat=multi by sending repeated tagDef parameters and, optionally, a comma-separated list to ensure unsupported formats are rejected.
Add an explicit idempotency test: issue the same DELETE twice sequentially and expect the second to return 204 with no changes.
Assert response headers for 204 (no Content-Type/body) and for error responses (proper Content-Type and meaningful error structure).
